comments:
This is noticed since dtp-sdk_1.0M2_N092906.zip build. Steps to reproduce
1. Create a Derby connection (Eg. jdbc:derby:/tmp/DerbyDB;create=true)
2. Try "Test Connection"; this results "Ping succeeded". and finish the wizard.
3. Right-click on new connection on DSE and select Connect
4. Fails with following the log
!ENTRY org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity 4 -1 2006-10-06 12:08:15.981
!MESSAGE Error creating SQL Model Connection connection to DerbyDB. (Error: null)
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.sqm.internal.core.util.DatabaseProviderHelper.getCatalogDatabase(DatabaseProviderHelper.java:37)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.sqm.internal.core.util.DatabaseProviderHelper.setDatabase(DatabaseProviderHelper.java:46)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.sqm.internal.core.connection.ConnectionInfoImpl.<init>(ConnectionInfoImpl.java:626)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.sqm.internal.core.connection.ConnectionFactory.createConnection(ConnectionFactory.java:36)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.sqm.core.SQMConnectionFactory.createConnection(SQMConnectionFactory.java:45)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.internal.ConnectionFactoryAdapterProvider.createConnection(ConnectionFactoryAdapterProvider.java:79)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.internal.CreateConnectionJob.run(CreateConnectionJob.java:55)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

!ENTRY org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity 4 -1 2006-10-06 12:08:16.051
!MESSAGE Could not connect to DerbyDB.
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity 4 -1 2006-10-06 12:08:16.051
!MESSAGE Error creating SQL Model Connection connection to DerbyDB. (Error: null)
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.sqm.internal.core.util.DatabaseProviderHelper.getCatalogDatabase(DatabaseProviderHelper.java:37)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.sqm.internal.core.util.DatabaseProviderHelper.setDatabase(DatabaseProviderHelper.java:46)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.sqm.internal.core.connection.ConnectionInfoImpl.<init>(ConnectionInfoImpl.java:626)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.sqm.internal.core.connection.ConnectionFactory.createConnection(ConnectionFactory.java:36)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.sqm.core.SQMConnectionFactory.createConnection(SQMConnectionFactory.java:45)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.internal.ConnectionFactoryAdapterProvider.createConnection(ConnectionFactoryAdapterProvider.java:79)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.internal.CreateConnectionJob.run(CreateConnectionJob.java:55)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.runtime 2006-10-06 12:08:16.061
!MESSAGE OK

Anthos:

Could you try this with the M2 build posted last Friday -- I wasn't able to repro based on the steps below.
I can't reproduce this using either a Generic JDBC driver, a Networked Derby driver or an Embedded Derby Profile, using the latest source.

This issue was only when when I start (child) Eclipse with selected DTP plugins from within Eclipse(parent). When attempted from parent instance it worked fine. On second look I realised that the dbdefinition plugins for derby and generic were not selected. With those selected it works just fine.

I had the o.e.d.connectivity.derby plugin selected in the Run configuration and the 'Validate Plug-in Set" validated this configuration to be fine. I think the dependency to the dbdependency plugins are not built into the o.e.d.connectivity.derby plugin.

The dependency is not required since the dbdefinition model instance is registered through an EMF url map extension.  This is picked up by the framework from the vendor and version information defined within the driver definition.  The framework uses the vendor and version information to construct a url, which is used to load the file.  Given that, the url map extension is required, not the ...derby.dbdefinition plugin (e.g., the derby.dbdefinition plugin could be removed so long as somebody defines a url map for derby_10.0).
